title: Who made Napoleon?
content:
Hi,

Does anyone knows who designed Napoleon (The Napoleon on the jpg) and where to get it?

:) Metthe

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Napoleon.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119092050/http:/typophile.com/files/Napoleon.jpg) | 30.03 KB |
author: Metthe

comments.content:
It’s a Linotype font, based on a 1976 typeface by Wulf Jarosch, according to the info in my Serif Font ID Guide. The sample below is from the Guide.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119092050im_/http:/typophile.com/files/napoleon_full_4706.gif)

Hmmm, interestingly enough I cannot find the font on Linotype’s site now. The samples were made for me by someone who had an extensive collection of Linotype fonts.

- Mike Yanega

If you look up Jarosch on [this page from the Kingspor Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119092050/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/Kuenstler.html), you will get a pdf that shows this work.

- Mike Yanega

Napoleon, IIRC, was one of the few freebies on an old LT type-on-demand CD, you know, the ones with oodles of encrypted fonts where you could buy the decryption key online.

Andreas
Thanks a lot! I will keep digging then, now with a designer :) Thanks again :)
